byline.contributor: Susanne Craig and Nate Schweber contributed reporting.
byline.original: By MARC SANTORA and BENJAMIN WEISER

abstract: Jury reconvenes in corruption trial of New York Assemblyman Sheldon Silver one day after juror makes impassioned plea to be dismissed from case, but does not reach verdict; jury will reconvene again following Thanksgiving holiday.
lead_paragraph: Before the court broke for the holiday, the judge rejected a juror’s request for a private meeting, saying it would be improper.

headline.main: Sheldon Silver Trial Jury Stops for Thanksgiving; Deliberations to Resume Next Week
headline.print_headline: Silver Trial Jury Stops for Holiday; Deliberations to Resume Next Week

snippet: Before the court broke for the holiday, the judge rejected a juror’s request for a private meeting, saying it would be improper.
